reviews.review_msg: I loved Rebecca! Her lectures were great - well-organized and well-thought-out although they could get a bit off-topic sometimes (but I like that kind of thing). It really helped in thinking outside the box on the topics we were talking about. It does have a large group project at the end, so be wary if you hate group work. Discussions were amazing

Lectures were riveting yet accessible and dialogue-based. Always made sure that every voice in the class was given a platform without letting things digress too much. Her empathetic & cerebral approach to teaching was astounding and she managed to transform the classroom into a genuinely safe space. I cried when I handed in my last assignment!!

She's not only understanding, considerate, and generally a positive and wonderful person, she's also brilliant? Very coherent and engaging lectures with wonderful discussions. She does have a bit of a hard time keeping the discussions from running long, so if you tend to talk a lot maybe hold back and let other people get a word in! ;)

Rob is a great prof, I wish he would teach more classes at SFU. He is a super nice, funny and caring person. His syllabus/grading criteria is very clear/straightforward, marking is easy if you put the effort in. His choices for readings were also super interesting and he's very passionate about what he teaches, he truly wants you to do well. Love!

A very nice guy that cares about his students, but the thing is, he's a teensy bit dumb. He likes to mark every version of a paper, which is fine but he marks like he's a friend editing a paper. Comments things in the margins which anyone with a bit of thought could figure out, like asking for a full explanation in the intro instead of reading more

Joy is a very radiant person and I think this quality helped make her class fun to attend and something to look forward to especially with remote learning. I took this course this past summer and it was my first gender studies class. She was super understanding of the current circumstances. I'd definitely take a class with her again.
